bropals.lib.simplegame

Class LWJGLGameWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.LWJGLGameWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameWindow

    public class LWJGLGameWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameWindow
    Not yet working. The LWJGL Game window implementation. Instead of the given render object being a Graphics object, it is a LWJGLContext object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LWJGLGameWindow(java.lang.String title)
      Creates a new windowed 640x480 LWJGL Game window with the given title.
      LWJGLGameWindow(java.lang.String title, int screenWidth, int screenHeight)
      Creates a new windowed LWJGL Game window with the specified title and screen size.
      LWJGLGameWindow(java.lang.String title, int screenWidth, int screenHeight, boolean fullscreen)
      Creates a new LWJGL Game window with the specified properties.

        public LWJGLGameWindow(java.lang.String title,
                       int screenWidth,
                       int screenHeight,
                       boolean fullscreen)
        Creates a new LWJGL Game window with the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the window
        screenWidth - the width of the window drawing surface
        screenHeight - the height of the window drawing surface
        fullscreen - whether or not this surface will be in fullscreen mode

      • setScreenResolution

        public boolean setScreenResolution(ScreenResolution screenResolution)
        Description copied from interface: GameWindow
        Sets the screen resolution of the AWTGameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the fullscreen state. If the screen resolution is not supported, this method returns false.
        Specified by:
        setScreenResolution in interface GameWindow
        Parameters:
        screenResolution - the new screen resolution.
        Returns:
        if the screen change was successful.
